Brief Hospital Course:
#PEs:
#IVC Filter:
#Lupus Anticoagulant:
The IVC filter removal was successful. Restarted apixaban given 
the PEs and no longer had IVC filter. He will follow up as an 
outpatient with vascular team for further plans on ___.

#Atrial Fibrillation w/ RVR:
Noted to have increasing episodes of atrial fibrillation with 
RVR up to rates in the 150s when ambulating a/w symptoms during 
admission. He was started on metoprolol. During uptitration of 
metoprolol, started to notice pauses on telemetry up to ___ 
seconds that were asymptomatic. Cardiology was consulted and 
felt that pauses were not likely to cause clinical issues. 
Metoprolol eventually titrated to 150mg daily of Toprol XL. On 
___, patient was deemed medically cleared to leave hospital. 
Telemetry was continued past this point, however he did not have 
any concerning findings up through ___ and will not require any 
continuous telemetry monitoring upon hospital discharge. On 
discharge, his PCP should eventually arrange for him to be 
referred to see an electrophysiology (EP) cardiologist to 
discuss option of rhythm control (?repeat ablation) given that 
despite close to maximal rate control he was still symptomatic. 
TTE performed in planning for eventual outpatient cardiology 
appointment, the results of which were pending at the time of 
discharge.

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___,

You were transferred from ___ due 
to pulmonary clots in your lungs and a poorly positioned filter 
in the large vessel feeding blood to your heart ("IVC Filter").

We removed the filter and started you on blood thinners 
(apixaban) and a medication to control your heart rate 
(metoprolol). It is very important to continue these 
medications, avoid alcohol, and get follow up with your primary 
care doctor and cardiologist. You were transferred back to 
inpatient psychiatric care after your stay here.

Sincerely,
Your ___ Team
